title: DatePicker & TimePicker with DateTime Format
body:

The way ist to set the date and the time part within the same DateTime datatype.
I've tried with picker callbacks and picker actions but not successfully.

Maye anyone has an advice for me ?


thx
author: tomatensaft

comments.body: Beware, DatePicker uses nullabel date, maybe it was that you tripped over. Anyway, if it solved your problem please close the issue.

Yes that's my Problem. I've bound a DateTime variable to the datepicker and added a callback to the timepicker.
With the callback of the timepicker i want to set the timespan to the bound datetime variable.

The problem is i can't add the timespan to the dateTime: 
```
if (timeSpan.hasValue) {
      dateTime.Date.Value.Add(timeSpan.Value);
}
```

There is no error message but it's not working. 
Do you you have an advice for me ?

thx
`date.Add(time)` of course creates and returns a new DateTime. You are trying to modify a datetime which is not how you do it. Save the result in a third variable.

title: Center the Title in Appbar?
body:

is there a way to center the Title in the Appbar?

what i've tried:

- Style="text-align:center;" to the appbar component

The Code:

    <MudAppBar Elevation="1" Color="Color.Dark" Style="text-align:center;">

Just add another ```<MudAppBarSpacer/>```:
```csharp

title: How to setup a sticky footer with MudBlazor
body: I have a requirement to setup a sticky footer while using MudBlazor. I tried creating one with MudContainer inside Footer.razor. then added it in MainLayout.razor below the MudMainContent element. I am missing how to specify it need to be hold in bottom of the page. Please help me .
author: umeshvenkat

comments.body:
```
<body>
  <header>
    App bar
  </header>
  <main>
    Page content
  </main>
  <footer>
    Social links
  </footer>
</body>
```

1. How to stretch the  <Main> Page Content to fill the available space? If content is not enough to push the footer to bottom it floats. otherwise the solution is works.
2. How to set the max-height of the Page content? A scroll bar needs to be displayed within the <main> section when the content grows larger.

Is there a MudBlazor way to handle this?
No there is no a MudBlazor way of doing it, but there is a CSS way of doing it, as I told you. Remember that Blazor is just web development

Best I have so far ``` ....
@Body
@copyRightNotice ``` The padding bottom in the main content means the content is not hidden by the footer once you get to the bottom of the page. Always going to need a bit of CSS unless we have a footer component with the CSS embedded in it.

> Best I have so far > > ``` > > > .... > > > > >
> @Body >
> > > > > > @copyRightNotice > > > > ``` > > The padding bottom in the main content means the content is not hidden by the footer once you get to the bottom of the page. Always going to need a bit of CSS unless we have a footer component with the CSS embedded in it. But that's not how it usually works, you don't want the footer to be always fixed/sticky, you want it to stick only if the page content is shorter than the viewport

> Best I have so far > > ``` > > > .... > > > > >
> @Body >
> > > > > > @copyRightNotice > > > > ``` > > The padding bottom in the main content means the content is not hidden by the footer once you get to the bottom of the page. Always going to need a bit of CSS unless we have a footer component with the CSS embedded in it. The problem with this solution is that if you have a long footer text, it tends to get squished and pop out the top on mobile.

title: AuthorizeView vs MudTable
body:
I have a code as follows:
```
        <MudTable Items="@_tournaments">
            <ToolBarContent>
                <MudText Typo="Typo.h6">Tournaments</MudText>
                <MudToolBarSpacer />
                <MudTextField @bind-Value="_searchString" Placeholder="Search" Adornment="Adornment.Start" AdornmentIcon="@Icons.Material.Filled.Search" IconSize="Size.Medium" Class="mt-0"></MudTextField>
            </ToolBarContent>
            <HeaderContent>
                <MudTh>Title</MudTh>
                <MudTh>Date</MudTh>
                <MudTh>Kind</MudTh>
                <MudTh>Actions</MudTh>
            </HeaderContent>
            <RowTemplate>
                <MudTd DataLabel="Title">@context.Title</MudTd>
                <MudTd DataLabel="Date">@context.Date</MudTd>
                <MudTd DataLabel="Kind">@context.Kind</MudTd>
                <MudTd DataLabel="Action">
                    <MudTooltip Text="Tournament information">
                        @{
                            var linkText = "/tournaments/view/" + @context.Id;
                        }
                        <MudFab Color="Color.Primary" Icon="@Icons.Material.Filled.Info" IconSize="Size.Small" Size="Size.Small" Link="@linkText" />
                    </MudTooltip>

`

title: Default value when using MudSelect with enum
author: ryanbuening

comments.body: Easy, please bind the select to `Nullable<Foo>` or `Foo?` and initialize it with `null` of course and you got what you need.
the items must be of type `Foo?` too

Try this:

`<MudSelectItem T="Foo?" Value="@item">@item</MudSelectItem>`

title: Binding Date Picker
author: SuliemanMansouri

comments.body: I am pretty sure your issue is that you are trying to bind `DateTime` to parameter Date which is of type `DateTime?`. In the new docs there will be a notice about this because it is a common pitfall.

You need a two-way binding, how else should the DatePicker be able to update your variable? 

`<MudDatePicker Label="Start Date" @bind-Date="StartDate" />`

title: How to set click events on a table row
body:

Luis

this question comes up so often that I am adding a OnRowClick callback to table
it is not optimal, someone pointed out that it fires not if you click the same row twice as this would not change the selected item. that's why I just added the event callback

title: MudSwitch error when updating from 1.1.5-net5 -> 1.2.0-net5
body:
The line of code below worked in 1.1.5-net, but doesn't in 1.2.0-net5. Note: Perhaps I'm using MudSwitch wrong, I don't know.

**In MainLayout.razor (_in MudAppBar_):**
`<MudSwitch Color="Color.Inherit" CheckedChanged="(() => currentTheme = (currentTheme == defaultTheme) ? darkTheme : defaultTheme)" Class="ma-0" />`

**Error:**
Severity	Code	Description	Project	File	Line	Suppression State
Error	CS0411	The type arguments for method 'TypeInference.CreateMudSwitch_0<T>(RenderTreeBuilder, int, int, EventCallback<T>)' cannot be inferred from the usage. Try specifying the type arguments explicitly.	Mediatheek.Client	D:\Repos\MediatheekNext\Mediatheek\Client\obj\Debug\net5.0\Razor\Shared\MainLayout.razor.g.cs	224	Active
author: JeepNL

comments.body: yes, that is because we made MudSwitch  and MudCheckBox generic types. Please add T="bool" to your MudSwitch

the upside of this change is that a MudSwitch now can be bound to `bool`, `bool?`, `int`, `int?` and `string`. Had you bound it to a boolean variable it would have been inferred without a compilation error. We knew about this potential breaking change, that's why we bumped the minor version. See #206
